results.title: Hanging Photo Display, Rustic Wood Picture Holder, Clothespin Picture Hanger, Photo Holder With Clip, Birthday Gift For Mom, Live Laugh Love
results.description:
This Live, Laugh, Love, Make Memories, Cherish The Moments picture/photo holder for hanging on a wall is a great addition to any room. Show off 6 of your favorite photos - just clip them on the attached mini clothespins. Hand-painted and decorated with a freestyle font, then lightly sanded for a distressed, worn, rustic look, this photo holder will add a touch of charm to your home once it's personalized with your own photos.

Made of varying sizes of fir wood in a tree-shaped design for an overall size of approx. 15" tall by 11.5" wide. It hangs with a piece of twine.

Makes a great gift idea for birthdays, Christmas, Valentine's Day, Mother's Day or other holidays, weddings, anniversaries, or housewarming.

I normally make these in black with white lettering and clothespins, but if you have another color combination in mind, please feel free to ask. I'll also be happy to finish it with a matte or satin varnish instead of giving it the rustic distressed look if you prefer.

Because they are hand-painted, no two are exactly the same. Slight variations will exist.

HOW TO HANG THEM- 
For small to medium sized letters: double sided foam mounting tape works great. Hot gluing ribbon to the back and then hang it on a nail. You can use dots of hot glue on the back of the letter and adhere it directly to the surface you are hanging it on.

results.title: My Observations on How Breaking One Chain with Baby Steps Can Cause a Chain Reaction
results.description:
My Observations on How Breaking One Chain (with Baby Steps) Can Cause a Chain Reaction

It was an early morning trek to Star Struck Coffee Shop to have another pleasant and relaxing visit with my longtime friend, Judy, Judy, Judy.

And...too soon for her to get going to her place of employment...so...we said our “See you laters”...hugged and went about our ways.

As I walked towards an almost crowded bus stop, I just leaned on a tree and once again placed my “Inspector Jacque Clouseau of the Sertiear” cap...watched, listened and learned.

3 men...two hippie-era dressed and one who appeared to be a close friend/relative sat together on one of the two, round metal covered benches.

On the other metal bench was a family of women and their children.  One woman stood holding her youngest in her arms and her 4-5 year old sat quietly.  The woman's friend stood at her side as they chatted in a foreign language.

I curiously watched the men giggle, mock and talk rudely to themselves.  It was obvious their conversation was about the women and their kids.  They (the women) looked angry and a bit fearful.

A few minutes later, a young woman walked to the bus stop and sat by the 4-5 year old girl.

As the 3 men continued their toxic conversation, the young lady who had just sat down turned and the reaction on her face was interesting.

When the bus arrived, the men boarded first...showing no respect for anyone else...then the family...then the young lady...then me.  And...as I sat at the back of the bus, I continued to observe, listen and learn.

The men sat together in the front area designated for the disabled and elderly.    The family was seated separately...the woman's friend sat with the 4-5 year old holding her hand opposite the 3 men and the mom holding her youngest (sitting on her lap) sat in the center seats.  The young lady appeared to have squeezed in and sat next to the mom.

As the bus slowly dropped off riders and picked up others, it was getting increasingly overcrowded...and...became more interesting as the ride continued.

The 3 men displayed very little concern or kindness to anyone else who boarded the bus.  They giggled, talked loudly...apparently getting "a kick" out of their own behavior/agenda.

The kid sat uncomfortably on her mother's lap and even more so as passengers pushed, bumping her small feet about when searching for a seat towards the back...obviously creating more anger in the mom.

The young lady turned and smiled at the mom...gently placed her child's feet safely between their sides.  It gradually became quiet.

After the 3 men exit the bus and others boarded, the women spoke to each other quietly and though I couldn't understand what they were saying, their body language told me more.

A high school student entered and was having a little difficulty finding enough $$ to pay his bus fare.  The woman sitting with the 4-5 year old said, “Here, you can have my bus pass…”
The student smiled and gratefully said, “Thank you” and sat down.

I could sense a bit of peace among everyone...even to the bus driver.

After arriving at my stop to transfer to another bus, my simple Inspector Clouseau side began to process the series of events that just occurred.

“Hmm...yes...yes…  “I believe something just happened here” he said in his usual French accent.  

Ehh...It seems that one simple act of kindness caused a chain reaction...just starting with “Baby Steps”  No?

Esther Monsalve
The Angel Shop

Note: Please use MEMO, an editor writing software, in oder to open this digital file.

results.title: Hand Painted Heart Clay Decoration
results.description:
These beautiful handmade clay decorations make a wonderful gift for any occasion. They look gorgeous hanging in your home and make lovely, unique additions to gifts such as flowers, wine bottles and gift bags. 

Each clay decoration is handmade to order and is lovingly hand cut and then carefully hand painted with an intricate heart design in a colour of your choice. The enamel paint used, gives off a beautiful shine when it catches the light, creating a stunningly eye-catching decoration. Your chosen word is then carefully hand painted on to the design, which is then finished with a length of jute twine.

Each decoration measures approximately 6.5cm/ 2.5” across.
Please select your choice of heart colour and your chosen word from the drop-down boxes. 

Please note, these items are made from natural materials including Italian air-dried clay and so will have a matte finish. As all of these items are hand made to order, they may include slight imperfections, however this adds to their unique and rustic charm!
All of the items in my shop are made by me, therefore please allow 1-2 weeks processing time.
Each item will be carefully packaged in its very own linen drawstring bag, perfect for gifting. 
For the full range of handmade gifts please visit my shop https://www.etsy.com/uk/shop/NaturallyClayGifts?ref=search_shop_redirect  

Please note, any items on which the clay tags are modelled are not included for sale in this listing.
